**Juku Isle** lies in the Western Sea, spanning three thousand *li* in circumference and located two hundred forty thousand *li* from the shore. Atop it stands a great mountain resembling the form of a human crow, hence named Renwu Mountain. Within lies the Cavernous Mystery Palace, and the mountain bears the Revert-Soul Fragrant Tree. Its form resembles paulownia blossoms, its fragrance detectable for hundreds of *li*. When its sap is refined into incense, it yields six varieties: the first, *Startling Essence Incense*; the second, *Thunder-Spirit Incense*; the third, *Return-Life Incense*; the fourth, *Thunder-Sandalwood Incense*; the fifth, *Phoenix-Essence Incense*; and the sixth, *Death-Repelling Incense*. These six names denote the wondrous treasures of the immortals. When the dead inhale its fragrance, they revive. Here too dwell the highest perfected transcendents within the grotto-heavens and palaces of the immortals. By the Han era, it had become accessible to the Middle Kingdom.

**Yan Isle** lies in the Southern Sea, spanning two thousand *li* in circumference and located ninety thousand *li* from the shore. For thousands of *li* on all sides, the land steams with scorching heat that blazes to the heavens. Birds flying high dare not cross the sea, for its waters boil on all sides. Atop the isle stands the Fire-Mountain Mouse, its fur several *chi* in length. Immortals gather its fur to weave into cloth, called *Fire-Cloak Fabric*. When made into garments and washed with water, they never become bright and clean; but when burned with fire, they turn as white as snow. The isle also produces the Wind-Born Beast, azure as a leopard cat. When piled with kindling and set aflame, its fur remains unchanged. Only when the dead beast is touched by wind does it revive. Above stands the Great Mountain Flowing-Fire Palace, where ten thousand immortal households are governed by the highest perfected transcendents and ranked immortals. By the Han era, it too had become accessible to the Middle Kingdom.

**Fenglin Isle** lies in the Western Sea, spanning one thousand five hundred *li* in circumference, encircled by Weak Waters where even a feather cannot float. The isle abounds with qilins and phoenixes, from which it takes its name. It yields Revert-Soul Incense and *Continuous-String Glue*. Immortals boil phoenix beaks and qilin horns together to make this adhesive, azure as jasper, also called *Linked-Gold Mud*—a divine and wondrous substance. Its land is rich with hills and mountains, where Wind Mountain’s rumblings shake like thunder. Though no wind stirs, towering waves rise a hundred *zhang*; only flying transcendents traverse its expanse—mortals can never reach it.

The land yields sweet dew, jade blossoms, and the **Purple Jade Palace**, where Heavenly Perfected Maidens and Female Transcendents reside. Mortals can never reach this place.

chunks.original_text: 冲妙先生李思聪集 天下名山二十八治 第一，阳平治。 上应角宿，下管金命人禄，寿祸福。 阳平治山在蜀都繁县界，去城一百八十里道，由罗江水两岐山口入，水道四十里，治道东有龙门，拒守神水，有二梧生其上。 西南有大泉，央水归束。 天师子嗣师讳自灵真君，以光和二年正月十五日於此山上升立碑一双，见在治门焉。 第二，鹿堂治。 上应亢宿，下管金命人禄寿祸福。 鹿堂山治在蜀都繁县界，北乡去城三百里，上有仙室，仙台，古人度世之处。 第三，鹤呜治。 上应氏宿，下管木命人禄寿祸福。 鹤呜山治，山顶与青城山，天相山相连，去成·都二百里，在蜀郡那县界。 径道三百里，世人不知昔马底何丹得道处。 治前，三水合成一带，神龙居之。 古有四兽头，金钉簪二石上，金银蚕二斛，又云尹喜先生主之。 又《神仙传》云：昔张天师世乱遇中国戈甲，乃於鹤呜山学道上升处。 第四，离沅治。 上应房宿，下管土命人禄寿祸福。 离沅山治在蜀郡繁县界，与鹿堂治相通。 其涧八十里，去成都二百五十里，上有百果灵松神草，服之长生，是四龙神骑之门。 昔范蠡得道上升之处。 第五，葛琐治。

**The Twenty-Eight Sacred Peaks of the World**

First: **Yangping Precinct**.
Corresponding above to the Horn Mansion, governing below the life, fortune, longevity, misfortune, and blessings of those born under the Metal destiny.
The Yangping Precinct mountain lies within the borders of Fan County in Shu’s capital, one hundred and eighty *li* from the city. The path follows the Luo River into the bifurcation of the Two Peaks Pass, with a water route of forty *li*. To the east of the precinct’s path stands the Dragon Gate, guarded by divine waters, upon which two parasol trees grow. To the southwest lies a great spring, where waters converge and flow onward.
The Celestial Master’s descendant, the Perfected Lord Hui Ziling, ascended here in the second year of *Guanghe* (180 CE) on the fifteenth day of the first month, erecting a pair of steles that remain at the precinct’s gate.

Second: **Lutang Precinct**.
Corresponding above to the Neck Mansion, governing below the life, fortune, longevity, misfortune, and blessings of those born under the Metal destiny.
The Lutang Precinct mountain lies within the borders of Fan County in Shu’s capital, three hundred *li* north of the city. At its summit stand immortal chambers and a terrace, an ancient site where transcendents attained liberation.

Third: **Heming Precinct**.
Corresponding above to the Root Mansion, governing below the life, fortune, longevity, misfortune, and blessings of those born under the Wood destiny.
The Heming Precinct mountain’s peak connects with Mount Qingcheng and Mount Tianxiang, two hundred *li* from Chengdu, within the borders of Pi County in Shu’s capital. The direct path spans three hundred *li*, though the world remains unaware that this was once the place where Ma Di and He Dan attained the Dao.
Before the precinct, three waters merge into a single stream, where divine dragons reside. Of old, four beast-headed figures stood, with golden nails piercing two stones, and two *hu* of golden and silver silkworms. It is also said that Master Yin Xi presided here.
The *Biographies of Divine Immortals* further record that when the Celestial Master Zhang encountered chaos and warfare in the Central Kingdom, he retreated to Heming Mountain to cultivate the Dao and ascend.

Fourth: **Liyuan Precinct**.
Corresponding above to the Chamber Mansion, governing below the life, fortune, longevity, misfortune, and blessings of those born under the Earth destiny.
The Liyuan Precinct mountain lies within the borders of Fan County in Shu’s capital, connected to the Lutang Precinct. Its ravine extends eighty *li*, two hundred and fifty *li* from Chengdu. At its summit grow a hundred sacred fruits, numinous pines, and divine herbs; those who consume them attain longevity. This is the gateway where the Four Dragon Spirits ride.
It was here that Fan Li attained the Dao and ascended.

Fifth: **Gexi Precinct**.

Tenth: **Lishang Precinct**.
Corresponding above to the Woman Mansion, governing below the life, fortune, longevity, misfortune, and blessings of those born under the Fire destiny.
The Lishang Precinct mountain lies within the borders of Deyang County in Guanghan Prefecture, one hundred and twenty *li* to the northeast. The mountain holds two stone chambers and one divine well. White deer, white cranes, and white turtledoves come and go like men. The precinct connects with Mianwu, and to the west, above the Stone Creek, three pines mark the site. The mountain rises two thousand nine hundred *zhang* above the plain. Here, Master Jizi and Wei Shuqing attained the Dao and ascended.

Eleventh: **Yongquan Precinct**.
Corresponding above to the Void Mansion, governing below the life, fortune, longevity, misfortune, and blessings of those born under the Wood destiny.
The Yongquan Precinct mountain once lay in Guanghan. Ma Mingsheng studied the Dao here and encountered the Most High Lord Lao, who bestowed upon him the method of transforming form. The precinct lies within the borders of Xiaohan County in Suining Prefecture. Above it is a spring whose waters cure all ailments; those who drink are instantly healed. Ancient tradition holds: the Blessed Water Precinct lies two *li* from Chengdu. A hundred-*zhang* cliff rises there, where apes and a hundred crows soar. The mountain is small yet lofty, with paths winding in all four directions.

Twelfth: **Chougeng Precinct**.
Corresponding above to the Rooftop Mansion, governing below the life, fortune, longevity, misfortune, and blessings of those born under the Fire destiny.
The Chougeng Precinct mountain lies in Nan’an County of Jianwei Prefecture, one hundred and ten *li* from Chengdu. Nine *li* from the Wenkou Mountain River, the peak rises one thousand seven hundred *zhang* above the city. Here, the Yellow Emperor cultivated the Dao and encountered the Nine Heavens Holy Mother, who bestowed upon him the *Canon of Elixirs* and the arts of war. To the left and right of the precinct stand imperial mulberry trees in succession. To the northwest flows the Flavor River. The mountain abounds with magic mushrooms and divine herbs; those who consume them attain longevity.

Thirteenth: **Beiping Precinct**.
Corresponding above to the House Mansion, governing below the life, fortune, longevity, misfortune, and blessings of those born under the Metal destiny.
The Beiping Precinct mountain lies in Nan’an County of Jianwei Prefecture, one hundred and forty *li* from Chengdu. The mountain holds a pool two hundred *bu* wide, within which grow divine mushrooms and herbs; those who eat them attain long life. Here, Wang Ziqiao of Yue and Lord Yu of Qingcheng once dwelled to cultivate the Dao. It is also called the Ke Mountain Precinct.

Fourteenth: **Benzhu Precinct**.
Corresponding above to the Wall Mansion, governing below the life, fortune, longevity, misfortune, and blessings of those born under the Wood destiny.
The Benzhu Precinct mountain lies in Nan’an County of Jianwei Prefecture, one hundred and twenty-five *li* from Chengdu. The mountain rises one thousand three hundred *zhang*. Above it is a stream, and to the north of the precinct lies a fragrant grove. A dragon cavern pierces through to Mount Emei. Above stand cassia and parasol trees. Here, Guo Zisheng attained the Dao. Behind it lies a bamboo grove. Fifteen *li* to the west, a tunnel was carved through to Mount Heming. At the tail of the mountain’s waters, dragons often sport within.

Fifteenth: **Mengqin Precinct**.
Corresponding above to the Straddler Mansion, governing below the life, fortune, longevity, misfortune, and blessings of those born under the Fire destiny.
The Mengqin Precinct mountain lies west of Nadu County in Jun Prefecture, twenty *li* from the prefectural seat and one thousand four hundred *li* from Chengdu. The precinct is separated from Jun Prefecture by a river. Before it stands a small mountain, and behind it, a great mountain rising one thousand *zhang*. Here, Yi Yin studied the Dao and ascended. It produces the Golden Liquid Herb; those who consume it attain long life.

Sixteenth: **Pinggai Precinct**.

Corresponding above to the Bond Mansion, governing below the life, fortune, longevity, misfortune, and blessings of those born under the Earth destiny.
The Pinggai Precinct mountain lies in Wuyang County of Jianwei Prefecture, eighty *li* from Chengdu. Beneath the mountain is a grotto, within which stands a jade figure thirteen *chi* tall, and three golden caskets. Here, Cui Xiaotong of Wu Prefecture studied the Dao and ascended. The mountain is traversed by a great river; to its south lies the Longevity Spring, and to its north, the Flat Plain Dragon Gate.

Seventeenth: **Yuntai Precinct**.
Corresponding above to the Helmet Mansion, governing below the life, fortune, longevity, misfortune, and blessings of those born under the Fire destiny.
The Yuntai Precinct mountain lies west of Langzhong County in Baxi Prefecture, sixty *li* from the county seat and one thousand three hundred seventy *li* from Chengdu. Four hundred disciples of Heavenly Master Zhang cultivated and refined their practice here. In the second year of Han’an, they ascended in broad daylight. Thereafter, Heavenly Master’s disciples Wang Chang and Zhao Sheng also refined elixirs and consumed them here, ascending to heaven. Before the precinct, Baxi’s great floodwaters once surged; within the mountain’s cliffs grows a peach tree that blooms once every three years and bears fruit once every five. It stands seven hundred *zhang* down a sheer cliff, above a bottomless valley. Only Zhao Sheng cast himself down to pluck the peach and present it to the Heavenly Master; no other could retrieve it. Within the precinct, jade maidens riding white cranes and white deer would suddenly appear to welcome the Heavenly Master’s ascent in broad daylight, witnessed by all the people. This is Mount Tianzhu. Before the Yuntai Precinct stand twin steles, still extant.

Corresponding above to the Pleiades Mansion, governing below the life, fortune, longevity, misfortune, and blessings of those born under the Wood destiny.
The Jinkou Precinct mountain lies in Jiangyang County of Hanzhong Prefecture, two thousand nine hundred twenty *li* from Chengdu. The waters of Hanzhong flow past the mountain, which is also called Pingyuan Mountain. To its west stretches a long ridge, and to its east, a flowing sea. The Water Lord governs here, and it is named the Azure Dragon Gate. Chen Anshi studied the Dao here and ascended as a flying immortal; Anshi was a native of Jingzhao.

chunks.original_text: 冲妙先生李思聪集 周天十－曜星君 日者，太阳之精，人君之象，日中帝君、仙官、神吏、万众皆修郁仪奔日之道。 日为洞阳之宫，自然化生空青翠玉之林，天官采食花实，身生金光。 日之精黑，化生金乌。 栖其林，朝出旸谷，夕没崎磁，一年一周天。 日宫太阳帝君，上管周天二十八宿星君，天曹注禄寿之司，常以三元万灵天官皆诣日宫，检校世人罪福之目，进呈 上帝，谓之阳宫生籍。 日魂吐九芒之黑，光莹万国。 日名郁仪。 月者，太阴之精，皇后大臣之象。 月中帝君、仙官、神吏，万众皆修结璘奔月之道。 月为广寒洞阴之官，自然化生，青华紫桂之林，亦日绛林。 枝叶红兰，神仙采食华实，寿同日月，升入玉清。 魄精之黑，化生玉兔。 一月一周天，月宫太阴帝君，下管五岳、四读、五湖、四海、十二溪水府，并邓都罗山。 百司常以三元日，冥官僚佐皆诣月宫，校定世人生死罪福之目，呈进上帝，谓之阴宫死籍。 月魄常泛十华之彩，光莹万国，月名结璘。 东方木德星君，木之精。 苍帝之子，光照三十万里，径一百里，十二年一周天。 真君戴星冠，蹑朱履，衣青霞寿鹤之衣，执玉简，垂七宝剑，白玉环佩。 下管人问山林、草木、龙蛇、鱼鳌、水族风雷之事，木之气直行仁和，司於有德。 南方火德，荧域星君，火之精。 赤帝之子，执法之星。 其精下降，为风伯之神。 常以十月入太微受事，光照八十万里，径约一百里，二年一周天。 星君戴星冠，蹑朱履，衣朱霞鹤寿之衣，执玉简，垂七星金剑，白玉环佩，管人问火焰、众虫、凤凰、鸡雉、乌鹊、百劳、群飞、乌雀之类，火德昭彰，巡行天下。 西方金德星君，金之精，白帝之子，主刀兵将军肃杀之威，其精下降为雨师之神。 光照七十万里，径一百里，一年一周天。 星君戴星冠，蹑朱履，衣皓鹤白霞之衣，执玉简，悬七星宝剑，垂白玉环佩，管人问金银、铜、铁、玉石、兔、牛、马、牲、豕、鼠、虫、石人、石马、霜雪之事。 北方水德星君，水之精。 黑帝之子，水德为天心，紫辰之星，正对昆仑之顶处。 紫微之宫，即元气之主。 其精下降为先农之神，主发生物，光照五十万里，径一百里，一年1 周天○ 星君戴星冠，蹑朱履，衣黑霞鹤寿之衣。 执玉简，悬七星宝剑，垂白玉环佩。 管人问水族鲛龙群鱼雪雹凝寒之事。 博大冠五行之首，生万物之根，海渎江河宰酌之事。 中央土德星君，黄帝之子，其精下降为灵。 星之神，光照十二万里，径五十里，二十九年一周天。 星君戴星冠，蹑朱履，衣黄霞鹤寿之衣，执玉简，悬七星宝剑，垂白玉环佩。 管人问兆庶形踝虫蚁之类，雾露虹蜕之属，土宿主信厚万物之事。 罗神首星君，主九天之下一切诸恶，星君戴星冠，蹑朱履，衣纯玄霞云之被，执玉简，垂七星金剑，带白玉环佩。 逆行天道，顺之则昌，逆之则祸。 计都神尾星君，主九天之下一切罪福，多主疾病困苦之灾。 星君戴星冠，蹑朱履，衣纯玄瑞云霞被，执玉简，垂七星金剑，带白玉环佩，逆行天道，不显神光。 顺之则吉，逆之则凶。 天一紫黑星君，戴星冠，蹑朱履，衣紫霞瑞云之被，执玉简，垂七星宝剑，带白玉环佩，长侍紫微垣门，降人问之百福，添禄算之司。

Master Chongmiao Li Sicong’s *Collection of the Ten Celestial Luminaries of the Zhou Tian*

The Sun is the essence of the Great Yang, the symbol of the sovereign. Within it dwell the Solar Emperor, immortals, divine officials, and myriad beings who cultivate the *Yuyi* path of hastening toward the sun. The Sun is the Palace of Penetrating Yang, naturally giving rise to forests of azure-green jade. Heavenly officials gather and consume its blossoms and fruits, their bodies radiating golden light. The dark essence of the Sun transforms into the Golden Crow. It roosts within these forests, emerging at dawn from the Valley of Yang and setting at dusk in the Crags of Qi, completing one circuit of the heavens each year.

The Solar Emperor of the Sun Palace governs the twenty-eight stellar sovereigns of the celestial sphere and the celestial bureau that registers life spans and fortunes. At each of the Three Primes, the myriad spirit-officials of heaven all journey to the Sun Palace to review the records of human transgressions and blessings, presenting them to the Supreme Emperor—this is called the *Yang Palace’s Register of Life*.

The solar soul emits nine rays of darkness, its radiance illuminating the ten thousand lands. The Sun is named *Yuyi*.

The Moon is the essence of the Great Yin, the symbol of the empress and her ministers. Within it dwell the Lunar Emperor, immortals, divine officials, and myriad beings who cultivate the *Jielin* path of hastening toward the moon. The Moon is the Palace of Vast Cold and Penetrating Yin, naturally giving rise to forests of azure-blossomed purple cassia—also called the Crimson Forest. Its branches and leaves are red as orchids. Immortals gather and consume its blossoms and fruits, their longevity equaling that of the sun and moon, ascending thereafter into the Jade Purity.

The dark essence of the lunar soul transforms into the Jade Hare. Completing one circuit of the heavens each month, the Lunar Emperor of the Moon Palace governs the Five Peaks, the Four Seas, the Five Lakes, the Twelve Streams, and the water palaces, as well as Fengdu’s Mount Luoshan. At each of the Three Primes, the officials of the underworld and their subordinates all journey to the Moon Palace to review and determine the records of human life, death, transgressions, and blessings, presenting them to the Supreme Emperor—this is called the *Yin Palace’s Register of Death*.

The lunar soul perpetually suffuses tenfold radiance, its light illuminating the ten thousand lands. The Moon is named *Jielin*.

The Star Sovereign of Wood Virtue of the East is the essence of Wood, child of the Azure Emperor. His light shines for three hundred thousand *li*, with a diameter of one hundred *li*, completing one circuit of the heavens every twelve years. The Perfected Sovereign wears a star crown, vermilion shoes, and a robe of azure mist and crane-feathered longevity, holding a jade tablet and bearing a seven-jeweled sword, with white jade pendants at his belt. He governs human affairs of mountains, forests, grasses, trees, dragons, serpents, fish, turtles, aquatic creatures, wind, and thunder. The *qi* of Wood moves directly with benevolence and harmony, presiding over those of virtue.

The Star Sovereign of Fire Virtue of the South, the Flaming Domain, is the essence of Fire, child of the Red Emperor and the star of execution. His essence descends to become the spirit of the Wind Earl. Each tenth month, he enters the Supreme Subtlety to receive his duties. His light shines for eight hundred thousand *li*, with a diameter of approximately one hundred *li*, completing one circuit of the heavens every two years. The Star Sovereign wears a star crown, vermilion shoes, and a robe of vermilion mist and crane-feathered longevity, holding a jade tablet and bearing a seven-star golden sword, with white jade pendants at his belt. He governs human affairs of flames, insects, phoenixes, pheasants, crows, magpies, shrikes, flocks of birds, and sparrows. The virtue of Fire blazes forth, patrolling the world below.

The Star Sovereign of Metal Virtue of the West is the essence of Metal, child of the White Emperor, wielding the awe of generals and the severity of execution. His essence descends to become the spirit of the Rain Master. His light shines for seven hundred thousand *li*, with a diameter of one hundred *li*, completing one circuit of the heavens each year. The Star Sovereign wears a star crown, vermilion shoes, and a robe of white mist and crane-feathered radiance, holding a jade tablet and bearing a seven-star precious sword, with white jade pendants at his belt. He governs human affairs of gold, silver, copper, iron, jade, stone, hares, oxen, horses, livestock, swine, rats, insects, stone men, stone horses, frost, and snow.

The Star Sovereign of Water Virtue of the North is the essence of Water, child of the Black Emperor. The virtue of Water is the heart of heaven, the Purple Dawn Star, directly aligned with the summit of Kunlun. The Purple Tenuity Palace is the master of primordial *qi*. His essence descends to become the spirit of the First Farmer, presiding over the generation of beings. His light shines for five hundred thousand *li*, with a diameter of one hundred *li*, completing one circuit of the heavens each year. The Star Sovereign wears a star crown, vermilion shoes, and a robe of black mist and crane-feathered longevity, holding a jade tablet and bearing a seven-star precious sword, with white jade pendants at his belt. He governs human affairs of aquatic creatures, sharks, dragons, schools of fish, snow, hail, and freezing cold. Vast and great, he crowns the Five Phases, root of the myriad beings, and oversees the regulation of seas, rivers, and streams.

The Star Sovereign of Earth Virtue of the Center is the child of the Yellow Emperor. His essence descends to become the numinous spirit of the stars. His light shines for one hundred twenty thousand *li*, with a diameter of fifty *li*, completing one circuit of the heavens every twenty-nine years. The Star Sovereign wears a star crown, vermilion shoes, and a robe of yellow mist and crane-feathered longevity, holding a jade tablet and bearing a seven-star sword, with white jade pendants at his belt. He governs human affairs of the multitudes, insects, ants, and the like, as well as mist, dew, rainbows, and mirages. The Earth Mansion presides over trustworthiness, generosity, and the affairs of the myriad beings.

The Star Sovereign of the Demon-Head governs all evils beneath the Nine Heavens. He wears a star crown, vermilion shoes, and a robe of pure dark mist and clouded radiance, holding a jade tablet and bearing a seven-star golden sword, with white jade pendants at his belt. He moves counter to the celestial Way; compliance brings prosperity, defiance brings calamity.

The Star Sovereign of the Demon-Tail governs all fortunes and misfortunes beneath the Nine Heavens, primarily overseeing disasters of illness and suffering. He wears a star crown, vermilion shoes, and a robe of pure dark auspicious clouded radiance, holding a jade tablet and bearing a seven-star golden sword, with white jade pendants at his belt. He moves counter to the celestial Way, his divine radiance concealed. Compliance brings good fortune, defiance brings misfortune.

The Star Sovereign of the Celestial Unity and Purple Darkness wears a star crown, vermilion shoes, and a robe of purple mist and auspicious clouds, holding a jade tablet and bearing a seven-star precious sword, with white jade pendants at his belt. He eternally attends the gate of the Purple Tenuity Enclosure, bestowing the hundred blessings upon humanity and overseeing the augmentation of life spans and fortunes.

The Seven Primordial Star Sovereigns of the Northern Dipper

The First Star of the Northern Dipper, Celestial Pivot, is the Star Sovereign of Greedy Wolf and Celestial Flower. Above, he governs the lodges of Chamber, Roof, House, Heart, Winnowing Basket, Ox, and below, the regions of Yang, Zheng, Yichong, and Xu. He oversees the life, fate, and official fortune of those born in the *zi* hour, recording the worldly affairs of those seeking office or position, and presides over the True Scripture of Prolonged Life through the Northern Dipper’s Yang Brilliance. The Supreme Palace of the Greedy Wolf Star Sovereign governs the sun. He wears a robe of vermilion radiance and crimson clouds, a seven-jeweled star crown, and serves as the Celestial Grand Commandant. His star spans nine hundred *li*, its light illuminating the ten thousand states.

The Second Star of the Northern Dipper, Celestial Wanderer, is the Star Sovereign of Gigantic Gate and Celestial Task. Above, he governs the lodges of Neck, Straddler, Well, Ghost, Spread Wings, and below, the regions of Lin, Jing, Chu, and Zhou. He oversees the life, fate, and official fortune of those born in the *chou* and *hai* hours, recording the worldly affairs of those seeking immortality and cultivating the Dao, and presides over the True Scripture of Calamity Transcendence through the Northern Dipper’s Yin Essence. The Middle Primordial Palace of the Gigantic Gate Star Sovereign governs the moon. He wears a robe of dark radiance and trailing clouds, a seven-jeweled star crown, and serves as the Celestial Grand Minister. His star spans five hundred *li*, its light illuminating the ten thousand states, and he presides over the court of awakening and Daoist cultivation.

The Third Star of the Northern Dipper, Celestial Mechanism, is the Star Sovereign of Emolument Storehouse and Celestial Pillar. Above, he governs the lodges of Bond, Stomach, Three Stars, and Willow, and below, the regions of Song and Yu. He oversees the life, fate, and official fortune of those born in the *yin* and *xu* hours, recording the worldly affairs of those seeking wealth and estates, and presides over the True Scripture of Life Preservation through the Northern Dipper’s True Lord. The True Primordial Palace of the Emolument Storehouse Star Sovereign governs fire. He wears a robe of vermilion radiance and auspicious clouds, a seven-jeweled star crown, and serves as the Celestial Minister of Works. His star spans seven hundred and twenty *li*, its light illuminating the ten thousand states.

The Fourth Star of the Northern Dipper, Celestial Balance, is the Star Sovereign of Literary Curve and Celestial Heart. Above, he governs the lodges of Ox and Rooftop, and below, the regions of Wu and Yue. He oversees the life, fate, and official fortune of those born in the *mao* and *you* hours, recording the worldly affairs of longevity, fortune, and physical appearance, and presides over the True Scripture of Literary Brilliance and Beneficence through the Northern Dipper. The Darkly Twisted Palace of the Literary Curve Star Sovereign governs wood. He wears a robe of blue-green radiance and auspicious clouds, a seven-jeweled star crown, and serves as the Celestial Itinerant Inspector. His star spans eight hundred *li*, its single brilliance illuminating the ten thousand states.

The Fifth Star of the Northern Dipper, Celestial Impulse, is the Star Sovereign of Integrity and Chastity and Celestial Bird. Above, he governs the lodges of Dark Warrior, Tail, and Woman, and below, the regions of Zhao, Ji, Wei, and Jin. He oversees the official fortune, fate, and blessings of those born in the *chen* and *shen* hours, recording the worldly affairs of marriage and concubines, and presides over the True Scripture of Disaster Dispelling through the Northern Dipper’s Cinnabar Primordium. The Palace of the Webbed Spirit of the Integrity and Chastity Star Sovereign governs earth. He wears a robe of yellow radiance and auspicious clouds, a seven-star precious crown, and serves as the Celestial Dipper Lord. His star spans seven hundred and twenty *li*, its light illuminating the ten thousand states.

The Sixth Star of the Northern Dipper, Celestial Yang, is the Star Sovereign of Martial Brilliance and Celestial Assistance. Above, he governs the lodges of House, Dipper, and Ox, and below, the region of Yan. He oversees the official fortune and fate of those born in the *si* and *wei* hours, recording the worldly affairs of livelihood, career, and wealth, and presides over the True Scripture of Disaster Dispersal through the Northern Dipper’s Northern Culmen. The Palace of the Bright Record of the Martial Brilliance Star Sovereign governs wood. He wears a robe of blue-green radiance and auspicious clouds, a seven-jeweled star crown, and serves as the Celestial Grand Master of Ceremonies. His star spans seven hundred *li*, its light illuminating the ten thousand states.

The Seventh Star of the Northern Dipper, Shimmering Brilliance, is the Star Sovereign of Ruptured Army and Celestial Pass. Above, he governs the lodges of Void, Wings, Horn, Straddler, and Base, and below, the regions of Qing, Qi, Wei, and Bingzhou. He oversees the official fortune and fate of those born in the *wu* hour, recording the worldly affairs of fortune, virtue, appearance, wives, concubines, servants, and maids, and presides over the True Scripture of Decline Support through the Northern Dipper’s Celestial Pass. The Palace of the Convergent Pass of the Ruptured Army Star Sovereign governs metal. He wears a robe of plain radiance, a seven-jeweled star crown, and serves as the Celestial Grand Minister. His star spans nine hundred *li*, its light illuminating the ten thousand states.

chunks.original_text: 夫三界者，欲界、色界、无色界，号日三界也。 初下六天为欲界。 中一十九天为色界，此二界劫数所为，阴阳所陶，炁有穷尽。 上有三天为无色界。 人有岁数，外有四种民天，日上至无上大罗之天，皆结虚无清净之炁，化生此天阳光照之，无日月之过焉。 此天之下即有晦明，皆三清大罗之境，不生不灭，无劫运之数，阳九百六灾所不及，为极道之，域，即万圣朝轩，元始真炁化生万物之根本矣。 洞渊集卷之九竟
chunks.translated_text:
The Three Realms are known as the Realm of Desire, the Realm of Form, and the Formless Realm—collectively called the Three Realms. The lowest six heavens constitute the Realm of Desire. The middle nineteen heavens form the Realm of Form; these two realms are shaped by kalpas and molded by yin and yang, their *qi* subject to exhaustion. Above them lie three heavens comprising the Formless Realm. Mortals are bound by years, while beyond them exist four heavens of Seed People, extending upward to the Supreme Great Luo Heaven. All are woven from the *qi* of emptiness and purity, transformed and illuminated by the yang radiance, untouched by the transgressions of sun and moon. Beneath this heaven, darkness and light arise—all realms of the Three Purities and Great Luo, neither born nor destroyed, beyond the reckoning of kalpas and the reach of the ninety-six disasters of yang. This is the ultimate domain of the Dao, the realm where all sages gather in homage, the very root from which the Primordial True *Qi* gives rise to the ten thousand things.

*The Ninth Scroll of the Dongyuan Collection is complete.*
